recommendations.recommendation:
This is NOT the greatest anime ever made. Not one bit close. Really. Legend of Blah-Blah-Blah focuses about human relations, politics, military and their impacts on flow of history. While some episodes are done with rare talent, extraordinary depth and colour, the next one of endless 110 is so much retarded, u cant help asking yourself - is this sh*t for real? When they decided to make 110 episodes of Democracy, they should have made 110 GOOD episodes. It`s like one episode characters speak of noble value of single person`s rights, and the other one 10 pentazillions of soldiers die, and no one gives a flying f*ck. Not to mention cheesy tactics genius Yan, small packs of useless unimportant spartans, dumbest admirals of known universe and lame repetative space fights.
It`s 8 of 10. with all respect to the old age.
Different from your everyday, run-of-the-mill anime, this is truly an epic story. It`s depth and incredibly large scope are astonishing, on par or even greater than Juuni Kokuki.

Great plot, exceptional character design. I liked the commentary about war and politics, and how different point of views were colliding and merging together as the serie progressed. The historical facts that were given were also a nice addition in understanding how the rivaling states were created. Despite the high episode count, I still wished at the end that there were still more episodes to watch! Definetly a must see!

A really nice series, even if the animation is pretty old-fashioned ;)
The story is nice, as it shows intrigues, politics but also nice space-battles.
Funny thing: The German names of the Empire-People! Being German myself I can tell :D Also the "Original German Titel" "HeR(!)densagen vom Kosmsosinsel" is just soo funny as there`s no correct translation to THIS sentence ;D
Very funny ;D I enjoy this series eitherway :D
best space opera anime there is :)
Great cast of characters, excellent plot
I rarely use word epic, but this deserves it.
Epic space opera. As others have said, real characters and strategic space battles.
Epic as epic can be - character development and plot continuity added to brilliant political and military tactics.
Space opera at it`s finest, must see.

The only downside to this anime is that it sets a standard that`s practically impossible to match. It`ll remain as the zenith of epic, multiple season-spanning series that involves intricate storyline for many years to come. Considering it already is 10 to 20 years old, its accomplishment is marvelous as it dwarfs brand new productions with its mature, serious and novelistic style. A must see for anyone who wants to watch a deep plot unfolding which is about politics, history and warfare.

The only bad thing about this anime is that it`s so good, it makes other anime series look bad. The best and most intelligent plot in any anime, and believable characters. Don`t let the relatively old age drive you off. While the visuals are old, they`re far better than most newer series.

A truly brilliant show and a must see if you`re interested in politically themed anime. The old-school animation and sheer number of episodes may seem off-putting to some, but if you want a rich, well developed story full of realistic characters and situations to sink your teeth into then you couldn`t do much better than this. My only possible complaints would be that there were so many characters (many of whom look quite similar) that I found it hard to keep track of all of them, and the current translations leave a little to be desired... but don`t let that put you off watching this classic masterpiece!

The [b]greatest anime ever created[/b], a [b]true classic[/b], a [b]masterpiece beyond words[/b]. [i]Epic plot, awesome cast and the most important of all, it`s damn realistic. The characters act the way humans would.[/i] Also to everyone crying about bad animation, the BDrips have been released and are pretty decent visually. [b]MUST WATCH IF YOU`RE LOOKING FOR A SERIOUS STORY.[/b]
Perfect epic.
The greatest anime ever created Just pick it up and watch and you will say the same thing as I.

Objectively best anime existing. Good characters, good plot, nothing extra and very cohesive.
For mature audience, with deep political and historical themes.

The one anime closest to perfection. The detail and scope that is present in Legend of the Galactic Heroes is enough to make you shake your head in disbelief.
A huge cast with no overtly edged personality types, perfect dialogue, classic music and tons of scheming, power play makes certain that the pace will never drop for the entirety of its 110 episodes duration.
one of the best retro anime ever produced epic storyline for a seinen anime shounen lovers look otherwise
This is greatest anime ever made. There are 162 episodes (main series and OVAs) and 3 movies with over 6000 named characters. And 2017 there is going to be a remake. I can`t wait.

I wanted to do a proper recommendation but find myself at a loss for words after watching the last episode. To put it simply: Legend of the Galactic Heroes is, without doubt, one of the finest achievements in anime history.

This one is one of THE must see shows. Not even just for anime viewers, for sci-fi lovers in general. I have never come across a space opera that mastered storytelling like this one, and once you have watched it, you will understand.
In recent years, some shows have taken up its torch of expansive worldbuilding storytelling, such as Game of Thrones, but this one preceeds them all, and arguably does it the best.
There are hundreds of characters, but even if you do not remember their names, you will remember them. If you are like me, you often only invest in shorter shows that you know can keep their steam and tell a cohesive story well. This show is over 100 episodes and still manages to do the same. Do NOT miss this one.

Coming from a long line of trekkies, I never thought I`d have another sci-fi series so easily surpass my expectations like this. LoGH is by far the best sci-fi series I have watched, read, or otherwise experienced. It is a lot more focused on the political side of science fiction than most in the genre, but I can only commend Dr. Tanaka and the others who worked on this for pulling it off so masterfully.
For the love of everything that is good in this world, [b]Watch this show[/b], you`re only doing yourself a disservice otherwise.
best space opera ever

A true classic beyond words and probably one of the most dialog driven anime ever.But it`s successful in technical aspects too.Unforgettable characters,very deep social and political commentaries,great space battles and intense drama makes this old(yet wise) pal a must see before dying.

Words just can`t describe how epic and all-encompassing this anime is. Impeccably retains an air of gravitas to the very end and beyond. A compelling galactic history, with agonising missed opportunities, plans within plans and actions that play themselves out in epic fashion without ever needing to resort to cheap sensationalism and cowardly cop-outs.

Best Space opera series ever. The character development its just amazing and plot is out of this world. Focuses a lot on realistic military strategy during the epic fleet battles as well. A true masterpiece.
Quite simply; Greatness.
Probably the best space opera out there.

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr991 [Tanaka Yoshiki]`s series of science fiction novels by the same name. It is late into the 36th century in the ancient Christian calendar; mankind, having developed the technology to travel faster than light speed and colonize many planets, has taken a hold of space, to the point of abandoning Earth almost entirely. Two superpowers comprising almost all the human population have now for one and a half centuries waged to a long stalemate a war for interstellar supremacy: the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire] and the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance]. When he was young and poor, http://anidb.net/ch186 [Count Reinhard von Lohengramm], a military genius born a noble in name only, saw his sister, http://anidb.net/ch205 [Countess Annerose von Grunewald], turned into an Imperial concubine; having once helplessly watched her being practically sold to http://anidb.net/ch206 [Kaiser Friedrich IV] as merchandise, he now seeks to crush the Emperor and free her. Meanwhile, http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli], an Alliance commander of similar calibre who really wanted to be a historian and not a soldier, wishes only for some peace and quiet; yet, as he unwillingly grows in relevance, he`ll see himself duty-bound to protect the Alliance`s democracy from the threat of the autocratic Empire. The collision of those two masters of tactics and strategy may bring the war to a close, provided, of course, that they aren`t first backstabbed by their respective countries` rotten internal politics... — written by Hinoe [i]Note: The original OVA release of mail-order VHS tapes were grouped into seasons as follows: Season 1: 01-26 (21.12.1988 to 20.06.1989) Season 2: 27-54 (21.06.1991 to 20.02.1992) Season 3: 55-86 (20.07.1994 to 16.01.1995) Season 4: 87-110 (??.09.1996 to 14.03.1997)[/i]

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: aristocrat
tag.description: An aristocrat or noble is a member of the aristocracy or nobility, an upper class in feudal societies. Nobles may or may not hold any specific nobility title. For simplicity`s sake, royalty should also be considered nobility.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: other planet
tag.description: The anime will fit this category if some or all of the action takes place on another planet which is supposedly in the same universe as Earth, not a complete fantasy world; usually there has to be some concept of space travel. The Latin name for Earth - Terra, would also pass the condition of being in the same universe as Earth. Basically, even mentioning of Earth existing or having existed would be enough. Although Moon is a moon, it also qualifies as Other Planet.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: sex
tag.description: Sexual intercourse, the ultimate bond of love and the "Origin of the World" (just think of Gustave Courbet`s painting: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L%27Origine_du_monde). Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: board games
tag.description: People here play a board game. It can vary from chess and Go, to Monopoly, to Dungeons and Dragons.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: conspiracy
tag.description: The conspiracy thriller (or paranoid thriller) is a sub-genre of the thriller which flourished in the 1970s in the US (and was echoed in other parts of the world) in the wake of a number of high-profile scandals and controversies (most notably Vietnam, the assassination of President Kennedy, Chappaquiddick and Watergate), and which exposed what many people regarded as the clandestine machinations and conspiracies beneath the orderly fabric of political life. The protagonists of conspiracy thrillers are often journalists or amateur investigators who find themselves (often inadvertently) pulling on a small thread which unravels a vast conspiracy that ultimately goes "all the way to the top".

tag.name: alcohol
tag.description: Alcohol (or more scientifically, ethanol), is one of the world`s oldest psychoactive substances. It is traditionally found in the form of a beverage such as beer, wine, or liquor, although in some contexts it can be inhaled to produce similar or intoxication, and some people prefer another way of consuming beverage-form alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are many and varied, due to production methods (fermentation or distillation), source materials (grains, fruits, vegetables, other plants), added substances such as flavorings, and many more ways of defining different forms of alcoholic beverages. Alcoholic beverages are divided into three general classes: beers, wines, and spirits. They are legally consumed in most countries, and over 100 countries have laws regulating their production, sale, and consumption. In particular, such laws specify the minimum age at which a person may legally buy or drink them. This minimum age varies between 16 and 25 years, depending upon the country and the type of drink. Most nations set it at 18 years of age.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: chess
tag.description: Chess is a game for two players. It is played on a square board, made of 64 smaller squares, with eight squares on each side. Each player starts with sixteen pieces (eight pawns, two each of knights, bishops, and rooks, and one king and queen). One player`s pieces are a light color, he is called "White", and the other player`s pieces are a dark color, he is called "Black".

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: space is an ocean
tag.description: The difference between space and ocean is marginal. In fact the two are completely interchangeable. Spacecraft are usually called ships and space forces use naval ranks. Movement in space is two-dimensional. There is friction. And not to forget space pirates are roaming through the galaxy and just so often you will encounter space whales. Some titles take this even a step further by actually displaying the space as a sort of gigantic liquid mass.

tag.name: strategy
tag.description: Instead of blindly running into a battle or trap, at least one of the protagonists devises a clever strategy to significantly improve the odds of victory.

tag.name: everybody dies
tag.description: Not necessarily everyone, but a good portion of the characters kick the bucket.

tag.name: coup d`etat
tag.description: A coup d`état (/ˌkuːdeɪˈtɑː/; French: blow of state; plural: coups d`état), also known as a coup, a putsch, or an overthrow, is the sudden and illegal seizure of a government, usually instigated by a small group of the existing state establishment to depose the established government and replace it with a new ruling body. A coup d`état is considered successful when the usurpers establish their dominance. If a coup fails, a civil war may ensue.

tag.name: dialogue driven
tag.description: A dialogue driven show has its story advanced by dialogue, with action being of much lower priority, and relies heavily on conversations between characters.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: gore
tag.description: A Splatter film or Gore film is a sub-genre of horror film that deliberately focuses on graphic portrayals of gore and graphic violence. These films, through the use of special effects and excessive blood and guts, tend to display an overt interest in the vulnerability of the human body and the theatricality of its mutilation. Due to their willingness to portray images society might consider shocking, splatter films share some ideological grounds with the transgressive art movement. The term "splatter cinema" was coined by George A. Romero to describe his film Dawn of the Dead, though Dawn of the Dead is generally considered by critics to have higher aspirations, such as social commentary, than to be simply exploitative for its own sake. [Source: wiki]

tag.name: rebellion
tag.description:
Rebellion, uprising, or insurrection is a refusal of obedience or order. It may, therefore, be seen as encompassing a range of behaviors aimed at destroying or taking over the position of an established authority such as a government, governor, president, political leader, financial institution, or person in charge. On the one hand the forms of behaviour can include non-violent methods such as the (overlapping but not quite identical) phenomena of civil disobedience, civil resistance and nonviolent resistance. On the other hand it may encompass violent campaigns. Those who participate in rebellions, especially if they are armed rebellions, are known as "rebels".
Source: Wiki

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: faster-than-light travel
tag.description: Faster-than-light travel is taken for grated in this anime. This is achieved by travelling via hyperspace, nullspace, or wormholes.

tag.name: social commentary
tag.description:
Social commentary is the act of rebelling against an individual, or a group of people by rhetorical means. This is most often done with the idea of implementing or promoting change by informing the general populace about a given problem and appealing to people’s sense of justice. (Source: Wikipedia)
Since this is anime, usually, the mores of Japan and the Japanese society are scrutinised, but not restricted to that.

tag.name: war-zone realities
tag.description: War is hell. This tag is for when characters experience the hell of war... not just the exciting stuff blowing up part.

tag.name: narration
tag.description: The most common example is that of a voice, either that of one of the characters or entirely unrelated, that appears at the beginning of an episode to offer a summary or introduction, and at the end of an episode for closure or for a preview to hint upon what to expect next. Another use of narration comes in the form of a dominant voice belonging to one of the protagonists, intended only for the viewer and revealing the intimate thoughts to whom it belongs. This type of narration occurs frequently throughout the duration of the episode or movie.

tag.name: loyalty
tag.description: Loyalty is faithfulness or a devotion to a person, country, group, or cause.

tag.name: machiavellian intrigues
tag.description: Named after Niccolò di Bernardo dei Machiavelli (3 May 1469 - 21 June 1527). Machiavelli is considered one of the founders of modern political science, and was a philosopher and diplomat. He is famous for his political treatise `The Prince`, which is essentially a manual about the acquisition and maintenance of power, including the need for deceit and the application of armed force. It is the use of deceit from which the term `Machievellian` derives. This term generally applies to a person who uses deceit to manipulate others for their own amoral (and usually power hungry) ends. This anime contains at least one character whose intrigues drive the plot.

tag.name: massacre
tag.description: Mass murder.

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: space opera
tag.description: Space opera is a sub-genre of fiction that emphasizes romantic adventures in space. Space opera generally involves large-scale conflicts between opponents with powerful abilities and technology. The genre will often be melodramatic, sometimes playing music that can be nothing short of awesome. Warfare and a battle of wits are usually less emphasized, preferring romance (with exceptions, e.g. Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu). Some space operas tend to be formulaic and sometimes even prosaic, often employing very simple devices and somewhat obvious strategies. An example of this would be the infamous laws of physics in the Macross universe, in which the main male lead will hardly ever get hit in battle.

tag.name: battle of wits
tag.description: There is some intellectual battle between the characters. They each might attempt to discern what the other knows and/or could be planning. Then, rather than simply relying on the use of raw power, try to deduce an effective strategy to foil their opponent(s). The battle of wits can be in the center of the intrigue or just a side story. Examples: Death Note, Code Geass

tag.name: predominantly adult cast
tag.description: This show features mostly adults. That means children and teenagers are relatively rare and unlikely to hold significance to the plot. That is a rare trait in anime, as most shows spin around children or teenagers.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Reinhard von Lohengramm
character.description: Reinhard was born into a poor noble family. He lived with his father and his older sister Annerose. His mother died when he was young so he knew very little about her. When Reinhard moved to a middle class suburban neighborhood, he met Siegfried Kircheis and they soon became inseparable friends. When his father sold Annerose to become Kaiser Friedrich IV`s concubine, Reinhard swore that he would overthrow the Goldenbaum dynasty to rescue his older sister. He left school to join the military academy and persuaded Kircheis to come along with him.

character.name: Siegfried Kircheis
character.description: Siegfried Kircheis is http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]`s childhood friend and ally, possessing comparable military and personal ability.

character.name: August Samuel Wahlen
character.description: August Samuel Wahlen was an admiral in the Imperial Fleet, serving under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Cornelius Lutz
character.description: Cornelius Lutz was an admiral in the Imperial Fleet, serving under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Karl Gustav Kempf
character.description: Karl Gustav Kempf was an Admiral of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire]. He was born in 762 UC and died in 798 UC at the Eighth Battle of http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn]. As punishment for being defeated, he was posthumously promoted only one rank instead of the customary two ranks. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Fritz Josef Bittenfeld
character.description: Fritz Josef Bittenfeld was an admiral in the Imperial Fleet who served under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] and was known for his fiery temper and aggressive battle tactics. His fleet, named the Black Lancers, was notorious for their speed and unmatched offensive power. The Black Lancers were distinguished by a black paint scheme, and used fast battleships in place of the standard battleship. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Ernest Mecklinger
character.description: Ernest Mecklinger was an Imperial high admiral who served under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] as the rear forces commander. Along with being an accomplished military officer, Mecklinger also was known for his artistic achievements, becoming nicknamed the "Artistic Admiral". Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Wolfgang Mittermeyer
character.description: Wolfgang Mittermeyer was an Imperial Fleet Admiral who served as the Supreme Space Fleet Commander under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] and was a skilled tactician, becoming one of the two "Twin Pillars" of Reinhard`s Goldenlöwe Dynasty. For his lightning-fast tactics in combat, Mittermeyer was known by the nickname of "Gale Wolf." He was a close friend of Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal], another brilliant commander and the second member of the Twin Pillars, with whom he served as one of the two best commanders in Reinhard`s New Galactic Empire. With the deaths of http://anidb.net/ch187 [Siegfried Kircheis], Reuenthal, and http://anidb.net/ch195 [Paul von Oberstein], Mittermeyer was the last of Reinhard von Lohengramm`s early supporters against the Goldenbaum Dynasty and high nobles left alive. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Oskar von Reuenthal
character.description: Oskar von Reuenthal was an Imperial Fleet Admiral who served as the Chief of High Command Office, Governor-General of the former Alliance territory, and was one of the "Twin Pillars" of Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard]`s Goldenlöwe Dynasty. Nicknamed the "Bewitching Eyes" for his http://anidb.net/t1065 [heterochromatic eyes], Reuenthal was a brilliant commander and was considered to be second only to Reinhard in terms of strategic ability. He was a close friend of fellow Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer], the Supreme Fleet Commander and the other one of the Twin Pillars of the Goldenlöwe Dynasty. The two of them were some of Reinhard von Lohengramm`s earliest supporters against the Goldenbaum Dynasty and high nobles ruling the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [first Empire]. However, after complex scheming by various interests behind the scenes, Reuenthal ended up being forced into rising in rebellion against his Kaiser, only to fall in battle. Fleet Admiral von Reuenthal had been regarded as one of the five best tacticians of that era, and also proved himself to be a capable administrator as the Governor-General of the occupied Alliance territories. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Paul von Oberstein
character.description: Minister of Military and Internal Affairs.

character.name: Hans Eduard Bergengrun
character.description: Assistant to both Siegfried Kircheis and Oskar von Reuental. Committed suicide following the defeat of Reuental`s rebellion and his death.

character.name: Hildegard von Mariendorf
character.description: Hildegard von Mariendorf is one of the principal characters in the series. She served as the New Galactic Fleet`s Chief Advisor, and later reigned with http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] when she became his wife and Empress in U.C.801. She was remembered by history as the one who nurtured the Lohengramm Dynasty to maturity, after her husband has established it. Hildegard, usually referred to by the nickname Hilde, was born in Galactic year 777 into an undistinguished noble family of the the Goldenbaum dynasty, the sole daughter of the benevolent and just Count http://anidb.net/ch203 [Franz von Mariendorf]. From an early age, she was distinguished from the other girls of the aristocrat society by her independent ideas. Completely unconcerned, Hilde pursued her own interests in reading, politics and history. Her mother having died when Hilde was young, her open-minded father respected Hilde`s unique ideas and choices in life.

character.name: Gregor von Muckenberger
character.description: Gregor von Mückenberger was an Imperial Fleet Admiral and one of three military chiefs of staff under Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV], during the waning years of the Goldenbaum Dynasty. Mückenberger was considered to be a competent leader and became one of the first Imperial elites to acknowledge the capabilities of http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. He decided to retire shortly after the death of Kaiser Friedrich IV and just before the outbreak of the civil war in the Empire, refusing overtures from the nobility of the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League] to support them. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Willibald Joachim von Merkatz
character.description: Willibald Joachim von Merkatz is the high admiral under kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Freidrich IV] who took refuge with http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang] at http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn] after the Lippschadt war. He was later forced into becoming the space fleet commander-in-chief of the Goldenbaum government in exile. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Franz von Mariendorf
character.description: Franz von Mariendorf was a member of the nobility, best known for helping to implement major reforms and being the first Minister of State of the Goldenlöwe Dynasty, as well as being the father of the empress and regent of the Goldenlöwe Dynasty, http://anidb.net/ch199 [Hildegard von Lohengramm]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Friedrich IV
character.description: Friedrich IV is the thirty-sixth Kaiser of the Goldenbaum dynasty.

character.name: Magdalena von Westpfahl
character.description: Baroness Magdalena von Westpfahl was a close friend of http://anidb.net/ch205 [Annerose von Grunewald].

character.name: Ulrich Kesler
character.description: Ulrich Kesler was an admiral of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire] who served as the Superintendent of the Imperial http://anidb.net/ch6228 [Military Police]. Among http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]`s original admirals, Kesler commanded a fleet the least amount of times. His accolades are better represented by his police work and reforms of the Imperial justice system. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Leopold Schumacher
character.description: Leopold Schumacher was an Imperial military officer who sided with the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League] during the Imperial Civil War. He was later involved in a Phezzani-conceived plot to abduct Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch225 [Erwin Josef II] and establish a http://anidb.net/ch6226 ["legitimate" Imperial government-in-exile] on Heinessen. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Alfred von Lansberg
character.description: Count Alfred von Lansberg was an Imperial high noble who became a military officer in the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League] during the Imperial Civil War, and later took part in a Fezzani-conceived plot to kidnap Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch225 [Erwin Josef II], becoming his unofficial caretaker. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Heinrich von Kunmel
character.description: Heinrich von Kümmel was a cousin to http://anidb.net/ch199 [Hildegard von Mariendorf]. Due to his chronically (indeed, terminally) poor health, he seemed to have been bed-ridden for most or all of his life, thus giving him the appearance of a man well older than he actually was. Heinrich held the title of Baron, though how powerful he was in the court of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire] must surely have been negligible due to his inability to actually participate in any obvious manner. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Nikolas Boltik
character.description: Nikolas Boltik was a http://anidb.net/t2322 [Phezzani] politician and diplomat who first served as the secretary of http://anidb.net/ch204 [Adrian Rubinsky] before being transferred to Odin as http://anidb.net/ch6233 [Phezzan]`s ambassador to the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire]. He ended up colluding with http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] to help him conquer Phezzan and the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance], subsequently becoming the governor-general of Phezzan under the New Galactic Empire. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Bernhard von Schneider
character.description: Bernhard von Schneider was an Imperial commander who was most notable for his role as the leading adjutant, subordinate, and a close confidant of High Admiral http://anidb.net/ch202 [Willibald Joachim von Merkatz], serving him faithfully from at least the Battle of Astarte (796 UC) to the Battle of Shiva (801 UC). During the late Alliance–Imperial War, the Imperial Civil War, and the following standoff between the New Galactic Empire and the http://anidb.net/ch6227 [Iserlohn Republic], Schneider was essentially apolitical and was mainly loyal to High Admiral Merkatz, providing him with assistance and counseling. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Staaden
character.description: Staaden was an admiral of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire]. During the Imperial Civil War, he fought for the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League].

character.name: Erlache
character.description: Rear Admiral Erlache was directly under the command of http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] at the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte].

character.name: Karl Edward Bayerlein
character.description: Karl Edward Bayerlein was an Imperial Admiral who was one of the most notable subordinates of Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Rupert Kessellink
character.description: Rupert Kessellink was a http://anidb.net/t2322 [Phezzani] politician who was both the son and secretary of http://anidb.net/ch204 [Adrian Rubinsky], the http://anidb.net/ch6233 [Dominion]`s last head of government. Kessellink was a highly ambitious Machiavellian schemer who saw himself as intellectually superior to everyone else and secretly plotted to eventually overthrow his father, to take his position as Phezzani Landesherr. Outwardly he served as Rubinsky`s right hand man, becoming involved in various political schemes as his father`s representative, including the arrangements for the inquiry into the loyalty of http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] Admiral http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli] and the abduction of Emperor http://anidb.net/ch225 [Erwin Josef II]. Unbeknownst to Kessellink, Rubinsky was fully aware of his son`s ambitions and in the end he had his son murdered when Kessellink tried to shoot him, on the night of http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]`s invasion of Phezzan. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Anton Hilmer von Schaft
character.description: Anton Hilmer von Schaft was an Imperial admiral who served under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] as the head of the Science And Technology Division, holding that post since around 792 UC. That made him one of the few high ranking officials from the Goldenbaum Dynasty that were able to keep their post after the Lippstadt War. Under the covert direction of http://anidb.net/ch6233 [Phezzan] he produced and implemented a plan to mobilize http://anidb.net/ch1760 [Geiersburg Fortress], which led ultimately to the Eighth Battle of http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn]. He was subsequently arrested on charges of corruption, embezzlement of public funds, tax evasion, and betrayal of military secrets. The evidence for it was given to the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Empire] by http://anidb.net/ch217 [Rupert Kessellink], on http://anidb.net/ch204 [Adrian Rubinsky]`s orders, as Schaft was no longer useful to them in the aftermath of the Imperial defeat at the Eighth Battle of Iserlohn. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Erwin Josef II
character.description: Erwin Josef von Goldenbaum II was the 37th and penultimate Kaiser of the Goldenbaum Dynasty. He ruled over the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire] in name only for about two years, with Prime Minister http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] holding most of the power, and was a key member of a http://anidb.net/ch6226 ["legitimate" Imperial government-in-exile] on Heinessen for nearly a year. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Glazunov
character.description: Glazunov was a http://anidb.net/t2322 [Phezzani] official who served as secretary to Phezzan`s ambassador on Odin, http://anidb.net/ch212 [Nikolas Boltik]. He was a party to the Phezzan-sponsored abduction of Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch225 [Erwin Josef II] in 798 UC, communicating with http://anidb.net/ch209 [Leopold Schumacher] and http://anidb.net/ch210 [Alfred von Lansberg], two former http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt] officers who were hired for the kidnapping, on Boltik`s behalf. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Neithardt Muller
character.description: Neithardt Müller was an Imperial Admiral who served under http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. As the person who had the most interaction with http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli]`s republican faction outside warfare, he was often appointed as Reinhard`s envoy when dealing with them. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Karl Robert Steinmetz
character.description: Karl Robert Steinmetz was an Admiral of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire], and the former captain of the http://anidb.net/ch1488 [Brunhild]. Later promoted to command of his own fleet, he was killed when http://anidb.net/ch1757 [his flagship] was hit and destroyed at the Battle of the Corridor. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Adalbert von Fahrenheit
character.description: Adalbert von Fahrenheit was a Vice Admiral in the Imperial Fleet. From a poor low noble background, he reached the rank of High Admiral under the http://anidb.net/ch186 [Lohengramm] regime and was the first officer of that rank to die, posthumously promoted to Fleet Admiral. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Ernst von Eisenach
character.description: Ernst von Eisenach was one of Kaiser Reinhard`s high admirals. Known as the "Silent Admiral" due to his taciturn nature, he preferred to gesture or signal with his hands whenever possible.

character.name: Jakob Hauptmann
character.description: Jakob Hauptmann was an Imperial captain who served as an agent of http://anidb.net/ch195 [Paul von Oberstein]. During the unrest on Odin, leading up to the Imperial Civil War, in 797 UC, Lt Commander Hauptmann took part in http://anidb.net/ch251 [Anton Ferner]`s attempt to assassinate http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. He later served the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League] and, but worked aboard http://anidb.net/ch1760 [Geiersburg Fortress] as an informant for Oberstein and the other forces loyal to Lohengramm, helping incite uprisings among Lippstadt troops and getting Commodore http://anidb.net/ch757 [Ansbach] arrested. Later, by 801 UC, Hauptmann had been promoted to captain and was serving the New Galactic Empire. That year, he took part in putting down a prison riot on Heinessen. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Anton Ferner
character.description: Anton Ferner was an Imperial rear admiral who became known for his role as a close aide of Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch195 [Paul von Oberstein], the Minister of Military Affairs under the Goldenlöwe Dynasty. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Flegel
character.description: Flegel was a baron and therefore a high noble, and the nephew of Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig]. He was involved in the imprisonment of then-Rear Admiral http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer] in 795 UC, paying an interrogator to torture him and after this was unsuccessful attempting to beat him personally. His pride stung by Mittermeyer accusing him of cowardice in beating a manacled man, he released the admiral`s handcuffs to fight him fairly but was easily defeated by Mittermeyer and called for his companions to shoot his opponent. This was foiled by the personal intervention of Admiral http://anidb.net/ch1687 [Reinhard von Müsel] at the request of Rear Admiral http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal]. Flegel cooperated with many high officers and nobles against http://anidb.net/ch186 [von Lohengramm]. In particular, he incited http://anidb.net/ch499 [Susanna von Benemünde] into plots to kill Reinhard or http://anidb.net/ch205 [his sister], all while being careful no definitive evidence could be traced back to himself. He was aboard http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress], holding the rank of Vice Admiral under Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch200 [Gregor von Mückenberger] who valued his political connections. Flegel accompanied von Mückenberger aboard http://anidb.net/ch82216 [his flagship] at the Fourth Battle of Tiamat. Following the battle, Flegel returned to Odin in 796 UC and conspired with Braunschweig to ensure that Reinhard would die in his next campaign. It was his proposal to leak Imperial plans to http://anidb.net/ch6233 [Phezzan], correctly guessing that the information would be sold to the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance]. Having been present at the formation of the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League], Flegel served his uncle as a Vice Admiral during the Imperial Civil War and died in a mutiny after insisting his ship make a suicide charge. His last words were "Long live the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Empire]." Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Otto von Braunschweig
character.description: Otto von Braunschweig was an Imperial Duke and the husband of Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV]`s daughter Princess Amarie, being among the most influential high nobles at court during the waning years of the Goldenbaum Dynasty. A major opponent of the upstart http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm], he stood for preserving the old order during the Imperial Civil War. Although he possessed much wealth and military might, Duke Braunschweig proved to be incompetent and came to be viewed as the personification of the decadence and decline of the Imperial nobility. He was forced to commit suicide by his chief retainer shortly after the confederated aristocrat forces were defeated by Lohengramm. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Wilhelm von Klopstock
character.description: Marquis Wilhelm von Klopstock was a disgraced former member of the Imperial high nobility, who died by suicide after a failed assassination attempt on Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV] in 796 UC. Deeply bitter toward Kaiser Friedrich IV and Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig], Marquis Klopstock blamed them for the untimely death of his only son and heir, Johann von Klopstock. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Cary Willock
character.description: Willock is a smuggler captain recruited by http://anidb.net/ch477 [Marinesk] to pilot the http://anidb.net/ch82028 [Beryoska] in http://anidb.net/ch269 [Boris Konev]`s absence.

character.name: Helmut Lennenkampf
character.description: Helmut Lennenkampf was an Imperial High Admiral and the Imperial Consul to the subjected http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance]. In December 792 UC, Lennenkampf was stationed at http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress] and held the rank of captain. He spoke to http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm], who was a commander at the time, about a mission that involved capturing Count Herxheimer, an Imperial noble attempting to defect to the Alliance. Lennenkampf, as an admiral, in 798 UC, was present for the testing of the warp capability of http://anidb.net/ch1760 [Geiersberg Fortress] and later took part in Operation Ragnarok. He fought at the Ninth Battle of Iserlohn under the command of http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal]. Alliance admiral http://anidb.net/ch741 [Dusty Attenborough] managed to trick Lennenkampf, however, and dealt his fleet significant casualties. In the end, the Alliance evacuated Iserlohn Fortress and left it to the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Empire]. His fleet briefly took part in a skirmish with the Yang Fleet during the Battle of the Black Hole, in March 799 UC. Lennekampf`s caution during the battle resulted in a successful attack by Admiral Yang`s forces, buying it enough time to escape. With the surrender of the Alliance to the Empire in the aftermath of Operation Ragnarok and the signing of the Treaty of Ba`alat, Lennenkampf was assigned to be the Imperial Consul on Heinessen, the representative of Kaiser Reinhard. He had the retired http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli] watched, suspecting him of wanting to rise up in revolt against the Empire. After the Alliance government attempted to execute Yang and his subordinates rescued him, they broke into the Consul`s headquarters, a hotel, and took him prisoner. Yang and his supporters intended to use him as a hostage to get themselves passage off of Heinessen. Lennekampf, ashamed for having been taken prisoner, committed suicide in his cell. Yang and his renegades claimed that he was still alive and took his body with them. They later returned it to the Empire by leaving it in a space capsule, along with a note explaining the circumstances of his death. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Arthur von Streit
character.description: Arthur von Streit was an Imperial vice admiral who served as a security advisor to Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Gunter Kissling
character.description: Chief of the Royal Guards.

character.name: Wilhelm von Littenheim
character.description: Wilhelm von Littenheim was an Imperial Marquis, son-in-law to Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV] as the husband of his daughter Princess Christine, and one of the most influential nobles at court during the late Goldenbaum Dynasty. Like his rival and later ally Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig], he was a staunch defender of the old order in the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Empire] and opposed http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] during the Imperial Civil War. However, Littenheim had no real martial talents and was defeated by Admiral http://anidb.net/ch187 [Siegfried Kircheis], whose fleet was half the size of the Marquis`s. Marquis Littenheim was killed by http://anidb.net/ch82213 [one of his former subordinates] while at http://anidb.net/ch82218 [Garmisch Fortress] shortly after his defeat in battle. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Felix Mittermeyer
character.description: Child of Elfriede von Kohlrausch and Oskar von Reuental who was adopted by the Mittermeyers.

character.name: Mainhoff
character.description: Chief Cabinet Secretary to Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Bruno von Silverberche
character.description: Talented and ambitious Chief Minister of Civil Engineering, tasked with the responsibility of establishing Imperial Governmental facilities on Phezzan.

character.name: Karl Blakke
character.description: A former noble who gave up his rank and title and worked towards the reformation of the autocratic rule of the Goldenbaum dynasty. Later made Minister of Civil Affairs by Reinhard, in recognition of the same.

character.name: Bernheim
character.description: Secretary of Protocol in Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Seefeld-hakase
character.description: Minister of Education in Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Bruckdolf
character.description: Chief of Legal Affairs under Kaiser Reinhard von Lohengramm.

character.name: Osmeyer
character.description: Minister of Internal Affairs in Kaiser Reinhard`s cabinet.

character.name: Heydrich Lang
character.description: Vice Minister of Internal Affairs and Chief of the Internal Security Department.

character.name: Fusseneger
character.description: Fusseneger was an aide of Admiral http://anidb.net/ch190 [Karl Gustav Kempf]. After the destruction of the Kempf Fleet, he served as Chief of Staff of Intelligence. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Susanna von Benemunde
character.description: Susanna von Beenemünde was http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Imperial] Consort to Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV] for several years, before he dismissed her in favour of http://anidb.net/ch205 [Annerose von Grünewald]. Unable to accept losing the emperor`s favour, Beenemünde hatched several plots to win back Friedrich`s favour. Mostly, these involved assassination attempts on Annerose`s younger brother, http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. These ill-conceived attempts all failed, yet there was never sufficient proof to indict the Baroness. As her last, desperate act, Lady Beenemünde decided to murder Annerose von Grünewald herself. Beenemünde`s grief at having been stricken from Friedrich`s sight was so great that she believed he would return to her, if only Annerose were dead. The plan failed, and at the order of the Kaiser, Beenemünde was forced to drink poison, thus committing suicide. It was announced to the public that she died of natural causes, and Kaiser Friedrich IV personally attended her funeral. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Marika von Feuerbach
character.description: Marries http://anidb.net/ch208 [Ulrich Kesler] two years after the events of the series.

character.name: Eugen
character.description: Eugen was an Imperial military officer who served as vice chief of staff to http://anidb.net/ch191 [Fritz Joseph Bittenfeld]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Wurmelink
character.description: Chief of Staff to Wahlen`s fleet at the 2nd Battle of Rantemario.

character.name: Lorenz
character.description: Adjutant to Grillpalzer.

character.name: Tonio
character.description: Gunner aboard the Flagship Barbarossa.

character.name: Volker Axel von Bullow
character.description: Volker Axel von Bullow was an Imperial admiral that served under Fleet Admirals http://anidb.net/ch187 [Siegfried Kircheis] and later http://anidb.net/ch193 [Wolfgang Mittermeyer]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Yang Wenli
character.description: Yang Wenli is one of two protagonists within the series. Like http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard], both of them share similar roles within their respective nations as famous national heroes renowned for their military skill. Compared to Reinhard, Yang is much more humble and dislikes his popularity as being a burden. Yang originally wanted to become a historian and only attended the Free Planets Defense Force Command Academy so he can get free education, while Reinhard relishes his fame and was ambitious to overthrow the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [empire]. At the start of the series, Yang has gained some fame as the "Hero of El Facil" for his exploits in the evacuation of the planet before Imperial occupation, and gains much more fame to become a national hero by the end of the first season. During the second season, he generally takes a lesser role compared to Reinhard, but returns in full force in third season before he is assassinated by members of the Terraist Church. Yang was a mild-tempered person who lives on red tea, a genius tactician and strategist that exceeds even Reinhard. His weakness lies in his unwillingness to risk democracy by assuming more direct powers and responsibilities. Not willing to take on a bigger role or responsibility, he and Reinhard`s battle were never in equal footing and at same time handcuffing him from doing things that could change the scale of the power balance. He also openly respects Reinhard and considers him to be a true genius as Reinhard`s ability does not seem to confine in just military affairs and is able to act on what his mind tells him while Yang might be reluctant to do so if given same situation. He also agrees that benevolent autocracy is better and more efficient than corrupted democracy if social change is needed, and noted that if he was born in the empire, he would actually volunteer to serve under Reinhard despite his dislike of military. On the other hand, he was glad to be born in Free Planets as it gives him the freedom, and believes that while democracy is less efficient and can be slowed dramatically with corruption it nevertheless is better because it is less likely to be corrupted completely and no one has absolute power, because after all, a good and wise Emperor such as Reinhard doesn`t come along often. The http://anidb.net/ch82015 [Hyperion] is the flagship of Yang Wenli`s fleet. It is retrofitted from a frontier security squadron flagship. It is lightly armed, possessing only 32 forward cannons which comprise its main armament. It possesses a large and spread out multi-level bridge with a large conference table commonly used for meetings by Admiral Yang and his staff, as well as a large tactical viewscreen used during battle to display fleet movements. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Olivier Poplin
character.description: Olivier Poplin was an Alliance Spartanian pilot. A flying ace with over 250 kills (which he estimated would put him in the all-time top 10), he moved up the ranks from flying officer when in http://anidb.net/ch740 [Vice Admiral Paeta]`s 2nd fleet through squadron leader, commanding one half of the Iserlohn stationed fleet`s Spartanians, to wing commander under http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wen-li]. Brash, hard-drinking, womanising and wise-cracking, he was the perfect foil to his good friend, the calm, nap-taking, crossword-puzzle-solving http://anidb.net/ch781 [Ivan Konev]. Together, the two of them were in charge of training fresh recruits to their squadrons. In this role, he mentored both http://anidb.net/ch1298 [Karin] and http://anidb.net/ch742 [Julian]. In keeping with his womanising and drinking, he flew with an ace of hearts insignia on his helmet and his Spartanian (No. 170), and his squadrons were named after a variety of liquors. He belied his brashness, though, by advocating teamwork and many-on-one tactics with his pilots, rather than urging them to individual glory.

character.name: Jean Robert Lap
character.description: Lt. Cmdr. Jean Robert Lapp was http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wen-li]`s friend from the days when they were classmates at the Officer Academy. He was held in high regard by Yang, who valued the fact that Lapp`s thoughts and methods differed from his own. He died in the http://anidb.net/e7160 [Battle of Astarte] when his ship, the http://anidb.net/ch82367 [Pergamonn], was lost in combat. He was posthumously promoted two ranks to the rank of Captain. At the time of his death, he was engaged to http://anidb.net/ch761 [Jessica Edwards].

character.name: Paetta
character.description: Paetta was a vice admiral who served the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] during the Battle of Astarte. He was killed during a riot at Rugpool Prison in 801 UC. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Dusty Attenborough
character.description: Dusty Attenborough is one of the commanding officers of the 13th fleet, and later, space fleet commander of the http://anidb.net/ch6227 [Iserlohn Republic]. Achieved the rank of Vice Admiral at his late twenties, even faster than http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Julian Mintz
character.description: Julian Mintz is the adopted ward of http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli], and a soldier of the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Job Trunicht
character.description: Job Trunicht was an http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Alliance] politician and its penultimate head of state, leading what was widely perceived as an incompetent and corrupt administration, a symbol of the decline of http://anidb.net/ch1026 [Arle Heinessen]`s legacy. Though democratically elected, Job Trunicht used fear to maintain his power—fear of the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire], and fear of his own secret police, the murderous http://anidb.net/ch82359 [Patriotic Knights Corps]. He was simply out for his own personal power and survival, becoming involved in factional politics and not caring for the future of the Alliance, despite outwardly preaching the opposite. Trunicht`s corruption was seen as one of the contributing factors to the fall of the Alliance and democracy to http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm]. After the defeat of the Alliance in Operation Ragnarök he took responsibility for the defeat and resigned, having surrendered the Alliance because his life was threatened by the Imperial Fleet. Following the complete subjugation of the Alliance during the Second Alliance–Imperial War, Trunicht made dealings with both the Church of Terra and the New Galactic Empire, ultimately betraying all of the factions that he once claimed loyalty to. Trunicht was later shot by http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal] shortly before the latter`s own death, after having insulted Kaiser Reinhard in their conversation. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Sidney Sithole
character.description: Sidney Sithole was a http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] flag officer. He was known for his "parallel pursuit" tactic during the Fifth Battle of http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn] and for his mentoring of http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Alex Caselnes
character.description: Alex Caselnes was an http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Alliance] vice admiral of logistics who served as a staff officer and close friend of Fleet Admiral http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli]. Regarded as being an efficient bureaucrat, he was an expert in administrative and logistical work, essentially being the chief of logistics for the Yang Fleet and http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Thoma von Stockhausen
character.description: Commander of the Iserlohn Fortress garrison.

character.name: Hans Dietrich von Seeckt
character.description: Commander of the stationed fleet, Iserlohn Fortress.

character.name: Walter von Schonkopf
character.description: Walter von Schönkopf was the commander of the http://anidb.net/ch6224 [Rosen Ritter]. An expert in ground warfare, he and his unit were important members of the 13th Fleet and later, the Yang Fleet and were responsible for undertaking any of their ground engagements. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Frederica Greenhill
character.description: Frederica Greenhill first met http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang] during the evacuation of El Facil. She joined the military to find him again and was assigned as his adjutant. Before the Battle of Vermilion, Yang proposed marriage to her and she accepted, and the two of them lived a married life for a few months before Yang was arrested by the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire]. During their time at the El Facil Revolutionary Government, she continued to serve as his adjutant. If not for a fever, she would have joined Admiral Yang aboard the http://anidb.net/ch82022 [Leda II] when he was assassinated. After his death, she served as the leader of the http://anidb.net/ch6227 [Iserlohn Republic] Supreme Council. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Dwight Greenhill
character.description: Admiral Dwight Greenhill was a highly respected officer, who served as chief of staff to http://anidb.net/ch744 [Fleet Admiral Sidney Sitolet] and later to http://anidb.net/ch769 [Fleet Admiral Lazll Lobos] during the invasion of the Galactic Empire in SC 796. His daughter was http://anidb.net/ch749 [Frederica Greenhill]. He led the http://anidb.net/ch6225 [National Salvation Military Council] during the military coup d`etat on Heinessen.

character.name: Edwin Fischer
character.description: Edwin Fischer was an Alliance vice admiral who was known for his role as a close associate of http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli], being an expert in ship manoeuvres and credited with being able to effectively carry out Yang`s tactics by coordinating precise fleet movements. He served as the vice commander of the Yang Fleet due to his abilities in coordinating ship movements. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Murai
character.description: Murai was a http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] officer who served in the 13th Fleet under the command of admiral http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli]. He was with the fleet from the very beginning, participating in the capture of http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress] in the Fifth Battle of Tiamat: prior to the battle, Murai expressed concern over the amount of trust Yang Wenli had placed in the http://anidb.net/ch6224 [Rosen Ritter]`s regimental commander, http://anidb.net/ch748 [Walter von Schönkopf]. Murai first met Yang Wenli while a commander assigned to investigate the mutiny at Econia. Murai`s impartiality and attention to details led him to conclude that Lt. Commander Yang was the more credible side in the incident. After the death of Yang, Murai left Iserlohn and returned to Heinessen as a private citizen. By doing so he swayed lukewarm supporters of the nascent Republic the opportunity to leave, stripping the numbers down to a hard core. He also felt it was time for his generation to step aside and allow younger leaders to carry on. Unexpectedly, Murai was selected by http://anidb.net/ch194 [Oskar von Reuenthal] as an civilian emissary to http://anidb.net/ch742 [Julian Mintz] to ask that that the Iserlohn Corridor be closed to Imperial traffic during von Reuenthal`s rebellion. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Kasper Linz
character.description: Kasper Linz was an http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Alliance] military officer who served in the http://anidb.net/ch6224 [Rosen Ritter] regiment, climbed the ranks and eventually became its commander. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Rainer Blumhardt
character.description: Rainer Blumhardt was a former http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Imperial] citizen of common birth, who after moving to the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] joined up with the http://anidb.net/ch6224 [Rosen Ritter]. A skilled soldier, Blumhardt participated in the infiltration of http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress] during the Seventh Battle of Iserlohn. He was later killed in 800 UC while escorting Admiral http://anidb.net/ch737 [Yang Wenli] to negotiations with http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm], when a group of Terraists boarded their cruiser. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Grand Bishop
character.description: Leader of the Terraism movement.

character.name: De Villier
character.description: Archbishop of the Terraism movement and responsible for carrying out many of its plans.

character.name: Ansbach
character.description: Ansbach was an aide to Imperial Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig], and was present at the Braunschweig estate during Marquis http://anidb.net/ch265 [Wilhelm von Klopstock]`s unsuccessful assassination attempt on Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV]. Ansbach sided with the nobles during the Imperial Civil War and served in the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt League]. He defended his lord when http://anidb.net/ch201 [Ovlesser] advanced upon Braunschweig and killed Ovlesser with his pistol. When http://anidb.net/ch254 [Braunschweig`s nephew] was killed in a rebellion on Westerland, Ansbach disagreed strongly with Braunschweig`s decision to use nuclear weapons upon the planet and instead advocated for punishing only the ringleaders of the rebellion. He was overruled and imprisoned for voicing an apparent defeatist opinion. He escaped from his imprisonment when Braunschweig had lost most of his support and was in imminent danger of capture. He disabused his lord of the possibility of alliance with http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] or escape, and coerced his lord to commit suicide. Ansbach offered Reinhard von Lohengramm the body of Duke Braunschweig in an attempt to assassinate Lohengramm. His attempt failed but he succeeded in killing http://anidb.net/ch187 [Siegfried Kircheis]. He committed suicide with a poison capsule that he had secreted in a tooth. Despite being disillusioned, Ansbach had remained loyal to Braunschweig and his final words were of apology to his lord. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Ottofried IV
character.description: The thirty-third Kaiser of the Goldenbaum dynasty.

character.name: Richard von Goldenbaum
character.description: Eldest son of http://anidb.net/ch1469 [Ottofried V]. Executed on charges of treason following a plot instigated by his younger brother, http://anidb.net/ch760 [Clementz].

character.name: Clementz von Goldenbaum
character.description: Middle son of http://anidb.net/ch1469 [Ottofried V]. After the discovery of his plot against his elder brother http://anidb.net/ch759 [Richard], he attempted to flee to Alliance territory, but died in the attempt.

character.name: Jessica Edwards
character.description: Jessica Edwards was a peace activist and politician, and the fiance of http://anidb.net/ch739 [Jean Robert Lapp]. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Raymond Togliatti
character.description: Raymond Togliatti was a politician running for election in Thernusen, the second largest city on the planet Heinnesen. Prior to the election he served as `manager of the National Peace Conference, Thernusen district.` Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: James Thorndike
character.description: James Thorndike was the Peace Party`s candidate in the Therneusen by-elections.

character.name: Cornelia Windsor
character.description: Cornelia Windsor held the post of Secretary of Transportation on the http://anidb.net/ch1535 [Free Planets Alliance] http://anidb.net/ch6231 [High Council]. She was an outspoken advocate of invading the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Galactic Empire] following the successful taking of http://anidb.net/ch1762 [Iserlohn Fortress], on the basis of saving humanity from the tyranny of the Empire and the Goldenbaum Dynasty. However she was also a cynical realist and was fully aware of the underlying motive for an invasion: in order to secure a major military success to shore up flagging opinion polls in time for the next election. She was voted out of office following the Alliance`s disastrous invasion of the Galactic Empire and their defeat at the Battle of Amritsar. Source: Gineipaedia

character.name: Andrew Fork
